This method gets a project builder/progress monitor from the java debug UI to 
build projects. However, it should only retrieve a progress monitor from the 
UI, and then build the projects itself. Otherwise, if the UI is not present, 
the build will never occurr.

There is a bug with the #getShell() code. It assumes it is being run in the UI 
thread, which is not always the case. This has caused the test suite to fail in 
the latest nightly builds.

Of course, this will cause the Debug UI to be loaded in the test suite, and we 
will have to get our test suite to work with the UI plug-ins loaded... one 
thing leads to another.

Or... the API between the core and status handler should pass the workspace 
operation to be run into the status handler. If there is no status handler, the 
core will run the operation itself. (Since the progress dialog has an API to 
fork the operation, it is not as simple as passing a progress monitor back).
